title: Best practices in sustainability communication and reporting among the world's largest companies in the realm of Industry 5.0

abstracts.content:
According to the European Commission’s (2021) viewpoint, the goal of Industry 5.0 is to promote a dynamic, human-centered, and sustainable industrial landscape. The importance of sustainable development has recently become more prominent. All stakeholders are tasked with implementing necessary solutions to overcome new requirements and obstacles to achieve the goals outlined in the UN 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, which has received support from European and international organizations. According to a KPMG report from 2021, 93 percent of the 250 companies with the highest global revenue now give an account of their sustainability initiatives.

This article has two objectives: first, to examine the extent to which businesses with the highest global revenues are involved in sustainable development initiatives; and second, to identify good sustainable development practices based on the established criteria.

These objectives were accomplished using databases like the Global Fortune 500 and the Forbes Top 100 Most Sustainable Companies of 2022 and documented strategies for communications and reporting on sustainable development advancements carried out by particular firms.

title: Challenges and opportunities for cultural diversity in managing research and educational institutions in the economic age of 5.0

abstracts.content:
Industry 5.0 is centered on a human-oriented approach, emphasizing the paramount significance of human capital, knowledge, and modern education. The future workforce is expected to possess not only digital and technical competences but also the often intangible “elusive soft skills”—encompassing multicultural communication, emotional intelligence, leadership, self-awareness, and critical thinking—all of which will hold substantial importance.

The objective of this chapter is to identify and analyze the opportunities and challenges presented by cultural diversity in the management of a specific organization, in this case, a private university. It is posited that the inherent cultural diversity in staff management, research, and education services necessitates the aforementioned “elusive soft skills.” This diversity also poses a host of challenges for management, administrative staff, and academics, each group experiencing its impact distinctly.

For academics, a multicultural environment offers numerous positive prospects, with its benefits outweighing potential downsides. Conversely, management and administrative staff are less influenced by these advantages. The selected case study revolves around the Vistula Group of Universities (VGU), specifically Vistula University in Warsaw (VU) and Wroclaw Business University of Applied Sciences (WAB). The former stands as one of Poland’s most internationalized institutions. To accomplish this objective, a survey conducted among employees of Vistula and WAB Universities will be utilized.

title: Sustainable development and transition from Economy 4.0 to Economy 5.0

abstracts.content:
The concept of Economy 5.0 is based on three key values: human orientation, sustainable development, and resilience to economic changes and crises. This is a development of the concept of Economy 4.0 (which precedes it) and includes processes of automation and the development of artificial intelligence.

The aim of this chapter is to identify the socio-economic characteristics of the economies of the individual countries of the European Union that influence sustainable development and, thus, form the basis for their smooth transitions from Economy 4.0 to Economy 5.0. The study used the WEF’s Global Competitiveness Index 4.0 (GCI 4.0). The authors assessed the selected components from 12 pillars and 4 categories and compared them with the 17 Sustainable Development Goals of the United Nations 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. The results showed that there was a correlation between the socioeconomic development of countries and their commitments to sustainable development.
